AllCCS

Zhiwei Zhou, Zhengjiang Zhu

true

2019-09-02

Source: vignettes/allccs.Rmd
allccs.Rmd

Introduction & Installation

AllCCS is a R packge which is used for collision cross section value prediction using machine learning approach.

You can install AllCCS from Github.

# Install `AllCCS` from GitHub
if(!require(devtools)){
install.packages("devtools")
}
devtools::install_github("justinZZW/AllCCS")

Examples

library(AllCCS)
#> 
#> More information can be found in http://imms.zhulab.cn.
#> If you have any questions, please send email to zhouzw@sioc.ac.cn or jiangzhu@sioc.ac.cn.
#> Authors: Zhiwei Zhou and Dr. Zhengjiang Zhu (jiangzhu@sioc.ac.cn).
#> Maintainer: Zhiwei Zhou
#> Version 0.1.2 (20190831)
#> --------------
#> o First release.
# direct predict from smiles 
test_smiles <- c("C=1C=C(C=CC1O)OC2=C(C=C(C=C2I)CC(C(=O)O)N)I", "CCOC1=CC=C(C=C1)NC(CC(C)O)=O", "CN1C=NC=C1CC(C(=O)O)(N)[H]")
test_names <- c('cpd1', 'cpd2', 'cpd3')

result <- CcsPredict(mol_smiles = test_smiles, mol_names = test_names, 
                     base_dir = '.', thread = 2, is_output = 'F')
#> Check smiles validity...
#> 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------
#> Check the mass range...
#> 
#> Calculate molecular descriptors...
#> 
#> Detected calculated molecular descriptors, and load it
#> 
#> Calculate m/z... 
#> 
#> Impute NAs...
#> 
#> Z-score scaling...
#> 
#> 
#> Molecular descriptors calculation has completed!
#> 
#> 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------
#> Predict CCS values ...
#> 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------
#> Calculate molecular fingerprinting...
#> 
#> Detected calculated fingerprints, and load it
#> 
#> Calculate Representive structure similarity ...
#> 
#> Calculate molecular fingerprinting...
#> 
#> Detected calculated fingerprints, and load it
#> 
#> Calculate Representive structure similarity ...
#> 
#> 
#> ------------------------------------------------------------
#> Export predicted result ...
#> 
#> The prediction has completed!
knitr::kable(head(result, 14))
name SMILES monoisotopic_mass adduct mz pred_ccs rss status
cpd1 C=1C=C(C=CC1O)OC2=C(C=C(C=C2I)CC(C(=O)O)N)I 524.8934 [M+H]+ 525.9007 195.9471 0.9698 Valid
cpd1 C=1C=C(C=CC1O)OC2=C(C=C(C=C2I)CC(C(=O)O)N)I 524.8934 [M+H-H2O]+ 507.8901 193.8554 0.9698 Valid

library(AllCCS)
# read from csv file
test <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "demo_data.csv", package="AllCCS"), stringsAsFactors = F)
test <- CcsPredict(mol_smiles = test$smiles, mol_names = test$id, thread = 2, base_dir = '.', is_output = F)
